etymology.description: The word 马上(馬上) (mǎshàng, "right away; immediately") combines 马(馬) (mǎ, "horse") and 上(上) (shàng, "on top; upward"). Historically, this term conveyed the sense of being mounted on a horse, ready to depart swiftly and promptly. When one was on horseback, they could move without delay, which has evolved into the figurative meaning of doing something "right away" or "immediately."

examples.chinese: 我马上就来(我馬上就來)，请你先喝茶(請你先喝茶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎshàng jiù lái, qǐng nǐ xiān hē chá.
examples.english: I'll come right away, please have some tea first.

examples.chinese: 他马上去超市(他馬上去超市)，买齐所有东西(買齊所有東西)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎshàng qù chāoshì, mǎi qí suǒyǒu dōngxī.
examples.english: He will go to the supermarket right away and buy all the things needed.

examples.chinese: 我们马上看完电影(我們馬上看完電影)，然后马上出发旅行(然後馬上出發旅行)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen mǎshàng kàn wán diànyǐng, ránhòu mǎshàng chūfā lǚxíng.
examples.english: We will finish watching the movie immediately, then set off for the trip right away.
